intro: Aneilema triquetrum, commonly known as the three-angled aneilema, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its trifoliate leaves, which are three-lobed and often arranged in a distinctive triangular shape. Its small, fragrant flowers are typically white or pale yellow and are clustered in umbels. Aneilema triquetrum is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along stream banks.
